intro: Ayenia mansfeldiana, commonly known as the red-tipped photinia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It features striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers, which appear in late spring. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall, adding ornamental value. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil. Ayenia mansfeldiana is often used in gardens for its colorful foliage and compact growth habit.
